parameters.content:
## Tool Calling
Connect any tool you want to the AI agent.
Update the prompt according to the specific tools you want to use.
This **allows the AI** to **interact with external services and APIs**.

## Discord AI Agent

### Update the prompt
**Modify the prompt** according to your specific use case and requirements.

### Variables used
- **date_message**: `{{ $now }}`
- **userId**: `<{{ $json.body.userId }}>`
- **discord_message**: `{{ $json.body.content.replace("<@botid>", "") }}` *Note: On the text field, replace **@botid** with the actual ID of your Discord bot*.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a Discord assistant thatâ€¦
[Provide instructions to the Discord AI Agent in Markdown or XML format, detailing how to use the available tools.]

**Always include the author by mentioning them with the provided <@userId> in your answer**.

parameters.content:
## Memory

This component gives the AI agent more context by remembering conversation history.
You can replace this with the memory node of your choice (e.g., Postgres for more persistent storage).

The variable `{{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.sessionId }}` is used to maintain conversations based on the **sessionId** generated from the Discord `bot.py` file.

## Discord AI Agent Workflow
This workflow serves as the foundation for using the Discord n8n AI Agent.

### The Python file 
The `bot.py` script runs on the service of your choice (e.g., a **[background worker on Render.com](https://render.com/docs/background-workers)**)

### Variables
The workflow receives the following variables via webhook:
- **content**: The message content from Discord
- **author**: The username of the message sender
- **userId**: The Discord user ID
- **sessionId**: Unique identifier for maintaining conversation context
- **timestamp**: When the message was sent

### Prompt
Update the **prompt** in the **"Discord AI Agent"** node to meet your specific needs.
If your bot will be used in public channels, ensure your prompt includes **appropriate guardrails**.

### Tool Connection
Connect **any tools you want the Discord AI agent** to **interact with** to provide answers directly on Discord.

### Character Limitations
Remember that Discord has a **2000 character limit** per message in its basic version.

## Webhook
This webhook receives the **message content**, **author id** , and a generated **sessionId** from the bot.py script.

It is only **triggered** when the bot is **mentioned** in a Discord message.

Add **header authentication** and edit your **.env** file with the same authentication token for security.

## Chat Model
This is the LLM used by the agent.
The default is `gpt-4o-mini` for its cost-efficiency.

You can replace this with **any model** of your choice that supports **tool calling functionality**.

## Respond to Webhook

This node sends the **response back to the webhook**.

The response will be handled by `bot.py` to provide an answer in the Discord channel where the bot was mentioned.
